page.title: 09Wormleighton Sheep Raising
page.content: For many years Border Leicester Sheep were raised in this area but with the change in public taste calling for lean meat a new breed of sheep is now bred called a Mule. The ram is always a Suffolk which is cross bred with a Masham ewe producing a compact black faced lamb with lean meat but not such a good crop of wool. One farmer in the area crosses the Mules again with a Suffolk ram and sells his lambs as Mule crossbreeds. Other farmers breed Texall sheep another type also producing good butchers meat.
